creator.name: สราวุธ ครองสัตย์

description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"ca7th","text":"Background:
Stroke-associated pneumonia (SAP) is a common leading cause of death during the acute phase. The A2DS2 score has been widely used to predict the risk of SAP. However, 24-hour non-contrast computed tomography-Alberta Stroke Program Early CT Score (NCCT-ASPECTS) and red cell distribution width (RDW) were not included in this scale. The purpose of the present study was to investigate the prognostic added value of combining 24-hour NCCT-ASPECTS and RDW with the A2DS2 score.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11},{"style":"sup","offset":110,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":113,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":475,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":478,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brelp","text":"Methods:
A retrospective study of thrombolyzed acute ischemic stroke (AIS) patients from January 2015 to July 2022. Data on A2DS2 scores, 24-hour NCCT-ASPECTS, and RDW were collected. Three logistic regression models were created: Model A used only the traditional A2DS2 score; Model B (A2DS2-c) calculated probabilities using a logistic equation; and Model C (combined A2DS2-MFP) used multivariable fractional polynomial logistic regression and incorporated the A2DS2 score, 24-hour NCCT-ASPECTS, and RDW. Ischemic brain lesions in the middle cerebral artery area were assessed using 24-hour NCCT-ASPECTS after completing 24-hour intravenous thrombolysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8},{"style":"sup","offset":125,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":128,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":266,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":269,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":288,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":291,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":371,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":374,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":464,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":467,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vm0","text":"Results:
Among a cohort of 345 thrombolyzed AIS patients, 70 individuals (20.3%) experienced SAP. The area under the receiver operating characteristic (AuROC) of 24-hour NCCT-ASPECTS and RDW were 0.841 and 0.621, respectively. The combined A2DS2-MFP calculation was significantly superior to the traditional A2DS2 score and A2DS2-c calculation (AuROC 0.917 vs. 0.880, P=0.026, and 0.917 vs. 0.888, P=0.024).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8},{"style":"sup","offset":241,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":244,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":309,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":312,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":325,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":328,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":368,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":398,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gs1q","text":"Conclusion: This study found that the 24-hour NCCT-ASPECTS and RDW enhanced the predictive value of the A2DS2 score for SAP after IV-tPA. The combined A2DS2-MFP model performed excellently in predictive performance, offering robust early SAP detection and potentially improving patient survival. Implementing this novel model in resource-constrained clinical settings could aid clinicians in effective monitoring, enabling risk stratification to guide clinical management.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11},{"style":"sup","offset":105,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":108,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":152,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":155,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"57i4u","text":"The Institutional Review Board of Saraburi Hospital granted approval for this study (Certificate No. EC043/2566), which was conducted in accordance with the Declaration of Helsinki (1964) and its subsequent amendments. In consideration\nof the retrospective design, Saraburi Hospital IRB waived the requirement for obtaining informed consent from each patient.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Medical Education Center at Saraburi Hospital

keywords: ASPECTS, A2DS2 score, ischemic stroke, stroke-associated pneumonia, thrombolysis
